intro: Anthospermum tricostatum, commonly known as the three-costed anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous areas.
